pros: Loved working there. The staff and coworkers are great
cons: The pay. Pay could be a little higher

pros: Some hardworking, under paid, sincere co-employees.
cons: Inconsistent direction, explanation, follow through and rationale from upper management; an outdated, failed orientation system; scattered, improbable planning and an unrealistic set up to be successful at your job is what you end up with here. Turnover in management is excessive and this place has a very long way to go to have a successful organization for assisting seniors.

review_title: Good people, not so good management
job_title: Activities Coordinator in New Hope, MN
pros: I enjoyed working with the residents and other employees
cons: Not compensated for the amount of work I put in

pros: Coworkers and residents are easy to work with
cons: Management was not the best

pros: Fridley co-workers, straight shift positions available.
cons: Scheduling, nurse to patient ratio

review_title: Housing Management and Corporate  want more and more with the Same amt of staff
pros: Cafeteria and having HR available
cons: No Appreciation ; No incentives; No budget for employees; old building; old Emergency response system; moldy, bed bugs; no budget for activities unless volunteers/donated and then poor;

review_title: A building that’s been around since 1968; still hasn’t got it rights

pros:
Work every other weekend
Little to no supervision
cons:
Low pay

job_title: Information Technology in New Hope, MN
pros: The staff becomes like family to you. The company is always trying to better the company in general.
cons: The workplace can be a bit stressful and hectic at times.

review_title: Great Residents, Poor Management with HHA staff esp in Memory care
job_title: Home Health Aide in Woodbury, MN
pros: The residents were the reason I went to work
cons: Management's lack of communication was awful, frequently short staffed, initial training was alright, high turn over. Lack of time by management spent with residents of memory care. Nurse often left early and was not really a good fit to be in memory care.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Woodbury, MN
pros: easy to be trained in and they offer bonuses for picking up shifts when they’re really short staffed. they also pay double for holidays
cons: short staffed frequently, they switch you around to different units and don’t tell you, never got my pto because it wasn’t ever entered into the computer/website

job_title: Therapeutic Recreation Coordinator in New Hope, MN
pros: Great staff that care about residents
cons:
No communication from upper management 
low pay

pros: Supervisors are very understanding and supportive
cons: This job at times can be very physically demanding

job_title: Food Server in Brooklyn Park, MN
pros: Fun place to work at times
cons: Have very poor communication often

pros: flexible in scheduling and training
cons: lack of communication from management

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Woodbury, MN
pros: The Residents and some Staff
cons: Very toxic , unprofessional , stressful, caregiver burn out , understaffed and management.

job_title: Nursing Assistant in New Hope, MN
pros: Quality care compared to a lot of nursing homes. Well staffed enough to always be able to grab a nurse or another assistant to assist with transfers quickly. Shifts available for pick up. Supplies freely available for cares. Great starting wage.
cons: Union prevented regular raises. Some of the nursing assistants were very unfriendly and hostile towards newcomers. I left because HR and the higher ups weren't intervening despite frequent complaints. The New Hope location was also so large that it became frustratingly "corporate" in the way that if you had a question beyond the nurse nobody knew who to send you to about it.

pros: the residents, patients, and families. the floor staff. health and dental, holiday pay, extra hours if you want them.
cons: impossible to get a day off. if you ever work on the tcu you will get at least 3 admissions every night and there is no admission nurse. you have to do your job and do the admissions.  long shifts. very low raises that don't even make a difference, 1 raise a year. management only cared about keeping the rooms filled.

job_title: Dining Services Aide in New Hope, MN
pros: I was a dining services aide. The shifts are short for evening (3.5 hours), so I was able to work often and balance school well. The job isn't too fast-paced, and you have quite a bit of time with nothing to do.
cons: If you want more hours as evening dining staff, there is not a good way besides working morning shifts.

pros: Had a fabulous administrator, but she is no longer there (left in 2014). Organization was really advanced in quality, systems, policies, training. Was well run in comparison to any other long term care organization I have been a part of.
cons: Clinical management was great with residents and families, but needed improvement in staff interactions.

job_title: Fabric Care/Housekeeping Aide in Brooklyn Park, MN
pros: Saint Therese is a very professional care center, and a lot of rooms for improvement.
cons: Improving management skills and helping low-skilled staff members to grow.

job_title: Dining Services in New Hope, MN
pros: management is very flexible, great job for a college student. they also offer benefits for attending school for nursing. Even a full ride at saint kates.
cons: not very much room for advancement. not a very fun atmosphere. its is not a place to work if you want to get rich

review_title: I was an in house trained Home Health Aide
pros: I was given a lot of freedom on the job to work independently in a home health care and memory care setting. I received excellent ongoing training and support on the job.
cons: There was a lot of management and staff turnover that affected staff morale.

pros: Much nicer working environment than typical nursing home.  Leadership seems to genuinely care and compensation is slightly higher than market. This is a small non-profit organization and not a multi-location chain so I think that helps in being heard.
cons: At time communication is sporadic and could be more consistent.

pros: Loved the residents and their families, good benefits, some of the staff are passionate about what they do.
cons: High turnover, understaffed and overworked HHA’s and  others

pros: Residents were wonderful and pleasant
cons: Horrible management and lack of professional leadership. Administrator plays favorites. Everyone is toxic. Residents suffer.

pros: beautiful facility, pay is a bit high average .
cons: You will have 1-3 new admissions in your shift everyday because the DON tries to make money. always overtime.

review_title: Wonderful team, great residents, fun working atmosphere.

pros: Great team.  Really works to improve the residents quality of life.
cons: Union creates a seperation between staff levels

job_title: Health Unit Coordinator in Saint Paul, MN
pros: Love everything about working at St Therese home
cons: There were no downside at working at that facility

job_title: Dining Services Director in Woodbury, MN
pros: Decent pay and benefits, residents are kind.
cons: Beautiful campus with ugly upper management. Sacrifice quality and care to pay for the building perhaps? Training non-existent, do not care about employees who have been loyal and sacrificed all for the company.

job_title: Food Server in Brooklyn Park, MN
pros: Loved the residents, coworkers were great. I recommend the position for high school students.
cons: Management may be a little messy.
